headline.main: A Brief Therapy Heals Trauma in Children

docs.abstract: A four- to six-session intervention to treat traumatized children and their families has been shown to be very successful.
docs.snippet: A four- to six-session intervention to treat traumatized children and their families has been shown to be very successful.

headline.main: 'Mad Men' Watch: Gloom for Betty and Roger

docs.abstract: Betty experienced hardship in her post-Don Draper life, and Roger Sterling was also depressed as he came to realize how marginalized he was in his own firm.
docs.snippet: Betty experienced hardship in her post-Don Draper life, and Roger Sterling was also depressed as he came to realize how marginalized he was in his own firm.

docs.lead_paragraph: The real estate agent Kathy Martin did not realize she had an exceptional talent for running until she was in her late 40s, but she has since broken several running records.

headline.seo: Kathy Martin Started Late but She Is Catching Up
headline.main: After Late Start, Runner Is Speeding Through Records

docs.abstract: Profile of runner Kathy Martin, real estate agent on Long Island, NY, who did not realize she had an exceptional talent for running until she was in her late 40s; at age 60, Martin continues to redefine what is possible for an older body, setting a string of formidable national and world records for her age group.
docs.snippet: The real estate agent Kathy Martin did not realize she had an exceptional talent for running until she was in her late 40s, but she has since broken several running records.

docs.lead_paragraph: In addition to tracking health symptoms, smartphone owners frequently downloaded apps to help manage their eating, drinking and exercise, and advertisers have noticed.

headline.seo: As Smartphones Become Health Aids, Ads May Follow
headline.main: As Smartphones Become Health Aids, Ads May Follow
headline.print_headline: As Smartphones Become Health Aids, Ads May Follow

docs.abstract: Young adults are much more likely than older people to have a smartphone and to use it to look for health information, a trend being noticed by advertisers; led by auto companies and packaged goods makers, they spent $3 billion online in 2011, including $818 million for mobile ads, more than for print or radio.
docs.snippet: In addition to tracking health symptoms, smartphone owners frequently downloaded apps to help manage their eating, drinking and exercise, and advertisers have noticed.

docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (13, 49) MARGARET MITCHELL: AMERICAN REBEL Mitchell, above, the author of ''Gone With the Wind,'' won a Pulitzer Prize for her novel and used royalties from it to pay for the education of some the first black doctors in the South. She was also among the first female newspaper reporters in Georgia. This profile, part of the ''American Masters'' series, includes re-enactments of her life based on her correspondence. 11:40 A.M. (IFC) THE TAVERN (2000) A bartender hears the knock of opportunity when offered the chance to own a tavern, only to learn that he is unprepared for the pressure and responsibility of running a small business. Ronnie (Cameron Dye), the man with the plan, doesn't have enough money, so he borrows some from his family and joins with his friend Dave (Kevin Geer), who ponies up the rest. But the competition in Manhattan is tough, and the bar's former owner opens a new establishment that attracts the old customers.

docs.lead_paragraph: The effort to confront cholera in Haiti was muddled by the United Nations’ apparent role in setting it off.

headline.seo: Haiti’s Cholera Outraced the Experts and Tainted the U.N.
headline.main: In Haiti, Global Failures on a Cholera Epidemic
headline.print_headline: Global Failures on a Haitian Epidemic

docs.abstract: Cholera has killed more than 7,050 Haitians and sickened more than 531,000 since the first case was reported in 2010; world has rallied to confront cholera, but the mission has been muddled by the United Nations' apparent role in igniting the epidemic and its unwillingness to acknowledge it; epidemiologic and microbiologic evidence strongly suggests that United Nations peacekeeping troops from Nepal imported cholera to Haiti and contaminated the river tributary next to their base through a faulty sanitation system.
docs.snippet: The effort to confront cholera in Haiti was muddled by the United Nations’ apparent role in setting it off.

byline.contributor: André Paultre contributed reporting from Port-au-Prince, Haiti.
